info.description: Chkk API for Kubernetes deployment and upgrade safety.
info.title: Chkk API v1.0

externalDocs.description: A detailed documentation of the Chkk API

tags.description: APIs used internally by Chkk components and are not meant for external callers
tags.name: Internal Endpoints

tags.description: APIs used to manage users, organizations and other identity concepts in Chkk
tags.name: Identity

tags.description: API used by the Chkk Agent or Chkk Operator that runs inside the K8s cluster
tags.name: Agent

tags.description: APIs used to manage LARs and their lifecycle
tags.name: LAR Status

tags.description: APIs used to manage the integrations of Chkk with customer systems (e.g. ticketing)
tags.name: Integration

tags.description: APIs used by the systems integrated with Chkk - not for management of such integrations
tags.name: Integration Data

tags.description: APIs that are not to be used for new features and we are working to phase out
tags.name: Deprecated

post.description: Accept an invitation into a Chkk team. This does not require further authentication, as it only executes prior-created invitations.

get.description: Retrieve all the subscriptions associated with a Chkk account

parameters.description: The slug of the account for which to retrieve subscriptions
parameters.name: account_slug

post.description: Add a new subscription to the account

parameters.description: The slug of the account for which to retrieve subscriptions
parameters.name: account_slug

get.description: Retrieve the details of a specific subscription

parameters.description: The slug of the account for which to retrieve a subscription
parameters.name: account_slug

parameters.description: The ID of the specific subscription to retrieve
parameters.name: subscription_id

put.description: Update the properties of a specific subscription

parameters.description: The slug of the account for which to retrieve a subscription
parameters.name: account_slug

parameters.description: The ID of the specific subscription to retrieve
parameters.name: subscription_id

get.description: List all teams in the given Chkk account

parameters.description: The slug of the account for which to manage teams
parameters.name: account_slug

parameters.description: The number of entries returned in a single call.
parameters.name: pageSize

parameters.description: The continuation token recieved in a prior call, for this call to return the next set of results
parameters.name: continuation_token

get.description: Get the details for a specific Chkk team in the Chkk account

parameters.description: The slug of the account for which to manage teams
parameters.name: account_slug

parameters.description: The slug of the team to manage
parameters.name: team_slug

get.description: List the pending invitations to the Chkk team.

parameters.description: The slug of the account for which to manage teams
parameters.name: account_slug

parameters.description: The slug of the team to manage
parameters.name: team_slug

parameters.description: The number of entries returned in a single call.
parameters.name: pageSize

parameters.description: The continuation token recieved in a prior call, for this call to return the next set of results
parameters.name: continuation_token

post.description: Add a new member to an existing Chkk Team. This creates an invitation as well as an email notification to the person added to accept the invitation (beforehand they will not be a member)

parameters.description: The slug of the account for which to manage teams
parameters.name: account_slug

parameters.description: The slug of the team to manage
parameters.name: team_slug

delete.description: Remove a user from a Chkk team. The user won't be notified about this change.

parameters.description: The slug of the account for which to manage teams
parameters.name: account_slug

parameters.description: The slug of the team to manage
parameters.name: team_slug

parameters.description: The id of the user which to manage
parameters.name: user_id

post.description: Endpoint for the Amplitude tunnel used by the web apps to report analytics.

get.description: List the status of all LARs for a cluster
Get the status of a specific LAR

post.description: Endpoint for reporting feedback about Chkk of different nature - user sign-up requests, k8s questions or general feedback

get.description: List the integrations configured in the Chkk account

post.description: Create a new integration in the Chkk account

delete.description: Delete an existing integration from the Chkk account

parameters.description: The ID of the integration to work with
parameters.name: integrationId

get.description: Get the details of an existing integration

parameters.description: The ID of the integration to work with
parameters.name: integrationId

put.description: Update an existing integration (e.g. with new status)

parameters.description: The ID of the integration to work with
parameters.name: integrationId

get.description: Retrieve the alert manager configuration snippet for the referenced integration

parameters.description: The ID of the integration to work with
parameters.name: integrationId

post.description: Login the provided user, and make sure their core data structures are ready for use (e.g. that they have an account setup for them)

get.description: Get the details for a specific organization

parameters.description: The slug of the organization to manage
parameters.name: org_slug

put.description: Update the details of a specific organization (e.g. the displayed name)

parameters.description: The slug of the organization to manage
parameters.name: org_slug

get.description: List the access tokens for the different accounts in the Chkk organization (for the calling user)

parameters.description: The slug of the organization to manage
parameters.name: org_slug

get.description: Get the ingestion token for the account

parameters.description: The ID of the ingestion scope to get the token for
parameters.name: id

parameters.description: the type of integration that the resource is retrieved for
parameters.name: integration_type

parameters.description: the name of the resource to be retrieved
parameters.name: resource_name

post.description:
Endpoint for the Sentry tunnel used by the web apps to report issues.

See https://docs.sentry.io/platforms/javascript/troubleshooting/#using-the-tunnel-option for more details.

The requests are in POST form, and consist of 3 lines with the first being a form of header containing the DSN of the report. The other lines report metadata as well as the stacktrace/breadcrumbs.
Submit status notification for an agent
Submit an install notification for an agent

get.description: Get details of the calling user
List the AvailabilityRisks in the account, filtered by the query parameters

parameters.description: The filter can include one or multiple clauses separated by commas, e.g., severity:low, need_attention:true, category:defects
parameters.name: filter

parameters.description: The number of entries returned in a single call.
parameters.name: pageSize

parameters.description: The continuation token recieved in a prior call, for this call to return the next set of results
parameters.name: continuation_token

get.description: Return aggregate counts for the AvailabilityRisks in the account, filtered and grouped by the query parameters

parameters.description: group_by can be repeated. Only category is supported value for the group_by clause.
parameters.name: group_by

parameters.description: The filter can include one or multiple clauses separated by commas, e.g., severity:low, need_attention:true, category:defects
parameters.name: filter

parameters.description: summary operation will apply filter and group_by clauses, and then count distinct values in the field specified for count parameter. Possible values are affected_resources, availability_risks
parameters.name: count

get.description: List the resourcs in this account affected by the AvailabilityRisk

parameters.description: availability_risk's id e.g. chkk-k8s-111
parameters.name: availability_risk_id

parameters.description: The filter can include one or multiple clauses separated by commas, e.g., type:cluster, cluster_id:k8scl_1234 etc.
parameters.name: filter

parameters.description: The number of entries returned in a single call.
parameters.name: pageSize

parameters.description: The continuation token recieved in a prior call, for this call to return the next set of results
parameters.name: continuation_token

clusters.description: list of resources affectd by the availability risks filtered by filter=type:cluster

addons.description: list of resources affectd by the availability risks filtered by filter=type:addon

namespaces.description: list of resources affectd by the availability risks filtered by filter=type:namespace

addons in cluster.description: list of resources affectd by the availability risks filtered by filter=type:addon&filter=cluster_id:k8scl_1234

namespaces in cluster.description: returns list of namespaces affectd by the availability risks filtered by filter=type:namespace&filter=cluster_id:k8scl_1234

ResolvedSubscription.description: Details of a subscription including potentially external information (e.g. from cloud marketplaces)

account_id.description: The Chkk account ID owning the subscription

subscription_id.description: The ID of the subscription itself

name.description: Human readable description of the subscription, e.g. "Chkk (Business Edition)"

SubscriptionType.description: The type of subscription aka how it is managed and charged

SubscriptionPlan.description: The kind of plan a subscription follows

ResolvedEntitlement.description: Description of a resource entitlement. This follows the Chkk pricing structure - please refer there for details of the different dimensions

node_count.description: Number of nodes across the infrastrcuture in this entitlement

small_clusters.description: Number of small clusters included in this entitlement

medium_clusters.description: Number of medium clusters included in this entitlement

large_clusters.description: Number of large clusters included in this entitlement

aws_registration_token.description: The registration token as vended by the AWS Marketplace

ListAccountTeamsResponse.description: A response to a request to list the Chkk Teams in a given Chkk Account

continuation_token.description: a token to get the next page of results, or an empty string if no further results are available

Team.description: A Chkk Team in a specific Chkk Account

slug.description: A human-readable, unique identifier for the Team

created.description: Time at which the Team was created. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch

updated.description: Time at which the Team was updated. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch

TeamMember.description: The details for a member of a Chkk Team

user_id.description: The ID of the user that is a member of the Chkk Team

user_email.description: The email address of the user that is a member of the Chkk Team

user_name.description: The name of the user that is a member of the Chkk Team

user_picture.description: A URL to a picture or avatar of the user that is a member of the Chkk Team

date_added.description: Time at which the user became a member of the Chkk Team. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch

MembershipStatus.description: The status of a user's membership in a team. A user can be INVITED (before they accept the invitation) or ACTIVE (they are a member of the team)

ListTeamInvitationsResponse.description: Response for listing invitations in a team

continuation_token.description: a token to get the next page of results, or an empty string if no further results are available

AddTeamMemberRequest.description: The body of a request to add a user to a Chkk Team

member_email.description: The email address of the user to add to the Chkk Team

production.description: whether this cluster should be considered to be part of production or not
whether this cluster should be considered to be part of production or not
whether this cluster should be considered to be part of production or not

cluster_id.description: The ID of cluster that the LAR exists in

jira_ticket.description: The JIRA ticket associated with the LAR

issue_id.description: The ID of the issue associated with the LAR

user_id.description: The ID of the user that updated the LAR's status

created.description: The time the LAR was created

updated.description: The time the LAR was last updated

ignore.description: Whether to ignore or unignore the LAR

acknowledge.description: Whether to acknowledge or unacknowledge the LAR

CreateClusterScanRequestBody.description: request from the collector to trigger the processing of a new scan

title.description: The type of the feedback request. NewSignUpRequest, ReportAvailabilityRiskRequest and k8sExpertRequest have special meaning but callers might also specify their own values

details.description: The actual feedback contents. For structured feedback calls this might be JSON embedded into the string to convey more information.

user_email.description: The email address of the submitter of the feedback, for Chkk to get back to them.

integration_token.description: token used with some integrations to validate the correct association

created.description: Time at which the Organization was created. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch

updated.description: Time at which the Organization was updated. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch

isEnterpriseInstall.description: Whether the installation was performed on an enterprise org. Synthesized as `false` when not present

enterpriseUrl.description: When the installation is an enterprise org install, the URL of the landing page for all workspaces in the org.

LoginResponse.description: Response to a login call, detailing the organizations available to a user

continuation_token.description: a token to get the next page of results, or an empty string if no further results are available

access_tokens.description: For each org ID that you have access to, this contains the access tokens needed to access it

AccountAccessToken.description: A mapping from account slug (in the org) to the access token

Organization.description: A Chkk Organization, which owns a set of accounts. In most cases a Chkk Organization will map 1:1 to a customer, with different departments and use cases being modeled as different accounts.

slug.description: A human-readable, unique identifier for the Organization

created.description: Time at which the Organization was created. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch

updated.description: Time at which the Organization was updated. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch

OrganizationStatus.description: Status of the Organization: active, inactive, deleted etc

UpdateOrganizationRequestBody.description: Update the details of a Chkk Organization

ListAccessTokensResponse.description: A list of access tokens the caller has access to

continuation_token.description: a token to get the next page of results, or an empty string if no further results are available

GetIngestionTokenResponse.description: A JWT as used by the Chkk API for authentication

token.description: The actual token to be used in Authorization header

created.description: Time at which the jwt token was created. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch

expiration.description: Time at which the jwt token will expire. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch

revoked.description: Time at which the jwt token was revoked. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch

CreateScanRequestBody.description: Start a scan of the provided cluster

id.description: The ID of the created Scan object

status.description: The last status of the create Scan object

created.description: The timestamp of the creation of the new Scan object

resource_id.description: The ID of the resource that the notification is about.

components.description: List of components reported as part of the notification.

AgentComponent.description: A component of the resource which submitted the notification.

image.description: The image mounted on the component.

image_type.description: Type of image the component uses. E.g OCI,AMI,etc

reason.description: The reason for the state of the component.

GetUsersResponse.description: Response to requesting details for the logged in identity

account_id.description: The ID of the Chkk Account of the current identity

email.description: The email address of the user of the current identity

name.description: the name of the user of the current identity

continuation_token.description: a token to get the next page of results, or an empty string if no further results are available

AvailabilityRisk.description: An Availability Risk is an instance of Availability Risk Signature which has failed in a cluster

AvailabilityRiskStatus.description: different states of an Availability Risk

AvailabilityRisksSummary.description: Counts of Availability Risks or affected resources, given a group by clause and filters

ListAffectedResourcesResponse.description: A response to a request to list the Resources in a given Chkk Account

continuation_token.description: a token to get the next page of results, or an empty string if no further results are available

Resource.description: A resource is an object of any kind in the k8s cluster, e.g. cluster, namespace, addons etc.

id.description: resource id, e.g. k8scl_1234, ngsamespace_id, addon_id etc.

metadata.description: resource's metadata, e.g., label, version, and region etc.

TeamInvitation.description: Details of an invitation for a user to join a Chkk Team

created.description: Time at which the invite was created. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch

expiry.description: Time at which the invite will expire. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch

AccessToken.description: An access token as used by the Chkk API for authentication

access_token.description: The actual token to be used in Authorization header

user_id.description: The ID of the user represented by the access token

org_id.description: The ID of the organization represented by the access token

account_id.description: The ID of the account represented by the access token

created.description: Time at which the access token was created. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch

SummaryEntry.description: examples: when counting Availability Risk with group_by only on category, each item will be like: {category:defects, count:9}
SummaryEntry.title: SummaryEntry
